content: I'm excited to share https://cloudblogs.microsoft.com/industry-blog/industry/health/microsoft-amazon-google-and-ibm-issue-joint-statement-for-healthcare-interoperability/ with an overview of the commitment that Microsoft and others are making to open standards
And they even mention "Testing" - much appreciate that.
digging this up... the press release says:

Open standards, open specifications, and open source tools are essential to facilitate frictionless data exchange

we commit to actively engaging among open source and open standards communities for the development of healthcare standards

We believe that a robust industry dialogue about healthcare interoperability needs will advance this cause

so... let's have some dialog - does anyone want to identify some useful contributions of specifications or tools that this group of cloud vendors could make to help make frictionless health data exchange a reality?
